paper_abstract: Let A be a set and let G be a group, and equip A(G) with its prodiscrete uniform structure. Let tau: A(G) -> A(G) be a map. We prove that tau is a cellular automaton if and only if tau is uniformly continuous and G-equivariant. We also give an example showing that a continuous and G-equivariant map tau: AG -> AG may fail to be a cellular automaton when the alphabet set A is infinite. paper_title: A generalization of the Curtis-Hedlund theorem
